text.0: my thought with fine discernment hath discovered the cow who wanders free without a herdsman.
text.1: her who hath straightway poured me food in plenty indra and agni therefore are her praisers.
text.2: indra and pūṣan deft of hand and mighty wellpleased have drained the heavens exhaustless udder.
text.3: as in this praise the gods have all delighted may i win blessing here from you o vasus.
text.4: fain to lend vigour to the bull the siste with reverence recognize the germ within him.
text.5: the cows come lowing hither to the youngling to him endued with great and wondrous beauties.
text.6: fixing with thought at sacrifice the pressstones i bid the wellformed heaven and earth come hither.
text.7: for these thy flames which give men boons in plenty rise up on high the beautiful the holy.
text.8: agni thy meathsweet tongue that tastes fair viands which among gods is called the farextended.
text.9: therewith make all the holy odes be seated here for our help and feed them with sweet juices.
text.10: let thy stream give us drink o god o agni wonderful and exhaustless like the rainclouds.
text.11: thus care for us o vasu jātavedas show us thy lovingkindness reaching all men.
